Ali + Moof 4.02.16

About Ali + Moof

When we met while working on the same-sex marriage campaign in Maine in 2012, we were deeply in love . . . Moof with Los Angeles, and Ali with Maine. Neither of us would have predicted that three years and many plane tickets later, we would be living together in a new city, planning a wedding that will now be recognized in all fifty states! But here we are. Together, we've learned to love hiking and running, and we've taken on the task of eating all the tastiest food in PDX. Ali appreciates Moof's excellent fashion taste and technological know-how and Moof benefits from Ali's green thumb, knack for cooking, and spider-killing skills. What more could a couple need to be happy?! Just our amazing friends and loving families. Thank you for being part of our wedding: we can't wait to celebrate our love and commitment to each other with all of you!

Isla Mujeres, Mexico
Banks, Oregon
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Ceremony + Reception

We are so happy that our friends and family will be gathering in Laguna Beach, California, to celebrate our love. The ceremony and reception will be held at the Surf & Sand Resort, about a twenty minute drive from where Moof grew up.

Saturday, April 2
  • 6:30 pm Ceremony on the Ocean Terrace
  • 7:00 pm Cocktails on the Sand Dollar Terrace
  • 7:45 pm Dinner in the Sand Dollar Ballroom
  • 9:00 pm Lantern lighting on the beach

Parking for guests is in the Surf & Sand's valet parking lot (free for wedding guests). Be careful turning off the Pacific Coast Highway, the driveway is steep!

We love your kids, and so children are welcome for all parts of the evening. And if you'd like, we will have a babysitter on site. Please contact Ali if you're interested in child care so we can make arrangements.

Accommodations

Hotels fill up fast in Laguna Beach; please make your hotel reservation as soon as possible. For hotels where we have reserved a block of rooms, mention our last names when booking to get the group rate. If you encounter any difficulty in booking a room, please let Ali know!

Surf & Sand Resort

This beautiful hotel right on the beach is where the wedding will be. We have set aside a small number of rooms for guests in this luxury hotel ($350/night plus taxes and fees). 855-690-7114

Best Western Plus Laguna Brisas Spa Hotel

We have a block of rooms for guests at this charming hotel, only steps away from the Surf & Sand Resort and the beach ($250/night plus taxes and fees). This is the perfect place to stay if you want an easy walk to and from the wedding. Click the link above to make a reservation with the block rate.

The Inn At Laguna Beach

This luxurious modern hotel is a little over a mile from the wedding location, and we have a block of rooms for guests here ($270/night plus taxes and fees). 800-544-4479

14 West Laguna Beach

This unique self-service hotel offers 14 studio-style rooms with a kitchenette and living area, making it a good choice for families or if you're planning a longer stay in Laguna Beach. It is about a half mile from the wedding location. We don't have a reserved block of rooms, so just call them if you're interested in making a reservation (rooms are in the low-to-mid $200s). 877-318-1552

Travel

There are plenty of airport options near Laguna Beach. Here are the three best ones:

  • LAX, the massive Los Angeles airport, is the furthest from the wedding location. LAX is over an hour from Laguna Beach without traffic, but at rush hour it could take as long as three hours. However, you'll get the most options for direct flights and airlines here.
  • SNA/John Wayne is the medium-sized airport serving Orange County, and the closest to the wedding venue. It is just 25 minutes from SNA to Laguna Beach, or 50 minutes in traffic. While SNA doesn't offer as many direct flights as LAX, you can find some great options through Alaska or Southwest.
  • LGB, the tiny Long Beach airport, is somewhere in the middle. It is a major hub for JetBlue, but only a handful of other major airlines fly in here. Long Beach to Laguna is 45 minutes without traffic or an hour and a half in traffic.

If you're just coming in for the wedding weekend, you might consider skipping the rental car. Laguna Beach is a very walkable town, with limited on-street parking and occasionally congested streets. All of the hotels we've listed have lots of restaurants and stores nearby - not to mention that the beach is just a few blocks away no matter where you are! You can book a shared ride from LAX to your hotel using SuperShuttle or a similar shared ride service. When we last checked, SuperShuttle's fee from LAX was $55 one-way and $9 for each additional passenger. From SNA, it was $29 one-way and $9 for each additional passenger.

Once you're in Laguna there is a free trolley on the weekends that can get you around town. It runs every 20 minutes, starting Friday at 4 pm until Sunday at 8 pm. There are other transit options around Laguna Beach too. Or, if you definitely want your own car, you could always join forces with someone else you know who is coming to the wedding. Let us know if you are looking for car match-making help.

Friday, April 1

Join us for celebratory drinks after the rehearsal dinner (location and time to be decided).

Saturday, April 2

Morning run to get out the pre-wedding jitters! We'll leave at 9:30 am from Irvine Bowl Park, which is a ten-minute drive from the hotels. The run will be on a quiet, hilly road without cars, and you can walk, run, or skip as you please!

Sunday, April 3

We'll be basking in newlywed bliss on the terrace at Surf & Sand, 15FiftyFive, from ten to noon. Please stop by, have some coffee and a bite to eat, and bask with us!
